results.title: Bertland
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Striving”.
The fastest 400 metre runner in the world in 1982 was Bertland Cameron from Spanish Town, Jamaica. Bert is studying at the University of Texas, at El Paso, and is there on an athletics scholarship which requires him to perform at his top if he wants to keep it. The pressure, and the tension it brings, continues as he prepares for the 400 metres final at the 1982 Brisbane Commonwealth Games.

results.title: Marathon
results.creator_credit: Bruce Ezard, Dennis O'Rourke, Graham Chase, Nick Torrens and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Striving”.
Robert de Castella is one of the top marathon runners in the world today and this film is about the preparation that led to his gold medal at the 1982 Commonwealth Games. The film includes personal films and snapshots that show de Castella’s early running career. These also give us an idea of how he developed the physical and mental stamina that a marathon demands.

results.title: Mountains of change
results.creator_credit: Peter Hicks, Peter Beilby and Entertainment Media
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Changing Australia”.
Using archival footage, interviews and dramatic reconstruction, this program presents a comprehensive history of skiing in Australia from its beginnings last century to the booming tourist industry it has become today.

results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Changing Australia”.
This is a documentary about unemployment and the resulting social implications in the Newcastle and Wollongong area, which has experienced a downturn in the steel industries.

results.title: No complaints as such
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Striving”.
Follows the training program of Karunakaran, Indian 52 kilogram class weightlifting champion, in the former palace of the Maharajah of Patiala. Looks at the crucial role of psychology in his preparation and shows the extraordinary relationship he has with his coach. Karunakaran is then shown in competition with Nick Voukelatos, a young railway worker from Sydney, at the Brisbane Commonwealth Games in 1982. Highlights the vulnerability of top sports people during performance and training and at other times. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Family life
results.creator_credit: Tony Chenn, Ugo Mariotti and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Changing Australia”.
Fairfield in Sydney is a community of diverse ethnic groups. This program looks at families from three of these groups - Australian First Nations people, Iola-Australian and Anglo-Saxon/Kampuchean. Each family is observed as they discuss how they cope and intend to cope with the cultural differences which surround them.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tony Chenn, Ugo Mariotti and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service

results.title: The Bank [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Robert Connolly, John Maynard, Arenafilm and Showtime Australia
results.brief_description: Winner of the Best Original Screenplay at the 2001 AFI Awards and nominated for another nine (including Best Film and Best Director), Robert Connolly’s “The Bank” is a highlight of contemporary Australian cinema. The hyper-intelligent, mathematics guru, Jim Doyle, gets a job at the largest bank in the country, Centra Bank, after convincing the CEO, Simon O’Reilly, that he is one step away from cracking the “holy grail” of economic theory - accurately predicting fluctuations in the stock market. Although the bank has closed multiple branches and slashed jobs, profits are still lagging and the Board demands results. For O’Reilly, Doyle is the answer to guaranteed ever-increasing profits and corporate expansion. His risk seems to have paid off when Doyle presents O’Reilly with a flawless formula that predicts an imminent stock market crash: the perfect opportunity for Centra Bank to gain extraordinary market control and power. Things take a dramatic, unexpected turn, however, when characters are revealed to be not what they seem. Doyle’s girlfriend, Michelle Roberts, is instrumental in uncovering the truth. Intercutting the scenes of corporate power and ruthlessness is the narrative of a pair of everyday ‘battlers’ whose lives are irrevocably damaged by Centra Bank, and seek revenge. Extremely well-crafted and well-scripted, “The Bank” is an engrossing, thoroughly entertaining corporate thriller. Shot entirely on location in Melbourne, it is an accomplished Australian genre film and its anti-bank, anti-corporate politics make it perfectly suited to contemporary audiences. Finally, “The Bank” is bolstered by flawless performances, including Anthony La Paglia as the evil O’Reilly and David Wenham as the sensitive, multi-layered Doyle, and a host of supporting actors including Sibylla Budd, Steve Rodgers, and Greg Stone.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Connolly, John Maynard, Arenafilm and Showtime Australia

results.title: Entree Jacques
results.creator_credit: Paul Sime, Colin South, John Tatoulis, Media World and SBS-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Changing Australia”.
Jacques Reymond, chef extraordinaire, came to Australia at the invitation of James Halliday and was so impressed by the quality of our produce and lifestyle that he has become an Australian. As the winner of a competition between Australia’s top chefs he was asked to prepare a meal using all Australian produce for an international competition in London. As he prepares for this event he visits the producers of his ingredients and talks about trends in Australian food. “Foodies” Rita Ehrlich, Terry Durack, Jill Dupleix and Kevin Donovan also participate.

results.title: Binning street
results.creator_credit: Gillian Coote and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Changing Australia”.
Looks at the range of people, culture, attitudes, traditions and the history that dwells in Binning Street, Erskineville. The program investigates current family life in Australian society in the 1980’s and how it has changed.
